name: Cloud Services SLA
text:
SERVICE LEVEL AGREEMENT

This Service Level Agreement ("SLA") is incorporated into the Master Services Agreement between CloudPlatform Inc. ("Provider") and Enterprise Customer Corp. ("Customer").

1. UPTIME COMMITMENT
1.1 Target. Provider commits to 99.9% monthly uptime for Production Services ("Uptime Commitment").
1.2 Calculation. Uptime is calculated as: ((Total Minutes - Downtime Minutes) / Total Minutes) x 100.
1.3 Exclusions. Downtime excludes: (a) scheduled maintenance with at least 48 hours notice; (b) Customer-caused issues; (c) force majeure events; (d) third-party service failures; and (e) features in beta or preview.

2. SERVICE CREDITS
2.1 Credit Amounts. If Provider fails to meet the Uptime Commitment:
- 99.0% - 99.9%: 10% credit of monthly fees
- 95.0% - 99.0%: 25% credit of monthly fees
- Below 95.0%: 50% credit of monthly fees

2.2 Credit Process. Customer must request credits within 30 days of the incident by submitting a support ticket with relevant logs. Provider shall verify and apply credits within 60 days.
2.3 Maximum Credits. Total credits shall not exceed 50% of monthly fees.
2.4 Sole Remedy. Service credits are Customer's sole and exclusive remedy for downtime.

3. SUPPORT
3.1 Levels. Provider offers:
- Standard: Business hours email support, 24-hour response
- Premium: 24/7 support, 4-hour response for critical issues
- Enterprise: 24/7 support, 1-hour response, dedicated engineer

3.2 Severity Levels.
- Critical: Service completely unavailable
- High: Major functionality impaired
- Medium: Feature degraded but workaround available
- Low: Questions or minor issues

4. MAINTENANCE
4.1 Scheduled. Provider may perform scheduled maintenance during maintenance windows (Sundays 2:00 AM - 6:00 AM Pacific) with 48 hours notice.
4.2 Emergency. Provider may perform emergency maintenance without notice if required for security or stability.

5. MONITORING
5.1 Availability. Provider shall monitor Services and provide status at status.cloudplatform.com.
5.2 Incident Communication. Provider shall notify Customer of material incidents via email and status page.

6. DATA
6.1 Backup. Provider shall perform daily backups with 30-day retention.
6.2 Recovery. RTO (Recovery Time Objective): 4 hours. RPO (Recovery Point Objective): 24 hours.

7. SECURITY
7.1 Standards. Provider shall maintain SOC 2 Type II certification.
7.2 Encryption. Data encrypted at rest (AES-256) and in transit (TLS 1.3).
7.3 Penetration Testing. Annual third-party penetration testing.

8. MODIFICATIONS
Provider may modify this SLA upon 30 days notice. Material adverse changes shall not apply to existing commitments until renewal.

9. TERM
This SLA continues for the term of the Master Services Agreement.

CLOUDPLATFORM INC.
Effective: January 1, 2024
